title: Is light a physical object? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. Light and colors are subjective sensations of living creatures as a reaction to signals form their senses. When we sense light it is usually because our eyes are exposed to electromagnetic radiation in the visible spectrum, quite a monstrous term but this is the physical object which we perceive as light. Just to demonstrate a non-spectrum example, when we receive blunt hit in our head we sometime see flush of light. This is a real sensation yet no “physical light” is involved. We do tend use the two terms interchangeably in everyday life and would call any power in the visible spectrum “light”. We say that “the sun emits light” and here we do mean a physical object, although a physicist would rather call it “power spectrum”.
